standardModel.title: Standard Model
standardModel.description:
Cost: 1
Speed: Very Fast
Reflection: Low
Usage: First Choice for clear and sharp photos (80% of cases).

advancedModel.title: Advanced Model
advancedModel.description:
Cost: 2
Speed: Fast
Reflection: In-depth
Usage: Backup Option for blurry or difficult photos (if Model 1 fails).

expertModel.title: Expert Model
expertModel.description:
Cost: 10
Speed: Slow
Reflection: Maximum
Usage: Last Resort for very rare and complex cases only.

creditsUsage.title: Smart Credit Usage
creditsUsage.objective: Your goal is to solve your identification with Model 1.

goldenRule.title: The Golden Rule: Image Quality
goldenRule.instruction: First and foremost, make sure your photo is sharp, well-lit, and that the subject fills the frame.
goldenRule.explanation: Why? Model 1 does not have much reflection. If it fails due to a bad photo, you will be forced to switch to Model 2, wasting 1 Credit. A good photo is the best way to save.

identificationStrategy.title: The Identification Strategy
identificationStrategy.note: Note that Models 1 and 2 alone solve the vast majority of identification cases.
identificationStrategy.step1: Start with Model 1. (The most economical and fastest).
identificationStrategy.step2: If the answer is unsatisfactory: Switch to Model 2. (It will solve almost all Model 1 failures thanks to its in-depth reflection).

lastResort.title: Last Resort: Model 3
lastResort.usage: Usage: Only for very complex cases that Models 1 and 2 could not solve. Use it with great caution.

imageIdentificationLimits.title: Limitations of Image Identification
imageIdentificationLimits.introduction: Image identification is a powerful tool, but it has its limits. Be aware of the following challenges:

whyNotAbsolute.title: Why identification is never absolute:
whyNotAbsolute.expertDifficulty: Even the greatest nature specialists are often unable to pronounce with absolute certainty on a simple image, especially for very similar species.
whyNotAbsolute.youngPlants: Young Plants: Plants do not yet have all the visible characteristics of adulthood, making their early identification very difficult.
whyNotAbsolute.closeRelatives: Close Relatives: Difficult to distinguish between very similar species when their points of divergence are extremely subtle.
whyNotAbsolute.naturalDiversity: Natural Diversity: Nature is immense (especially insects). The number of known subjects is so vast that distinguishing between them is extremely complex, even for experts.

imageIdentificationLimits.conclusion: Despite all these limitations, You have in your hands the most powerful and fastest guide to explore the world around you!
